perturbation.original_text: 1. Beijing SINA and SINA Leju agree that, upon the date of execution of this Termination Agreement, the Agreement shall terminate and be of no further force or effect, and, for the avoidance of doubt, no provisions of the Original Agreement survive such termination.
perturbation.changed_text: 1. Beijing SINA and SINA Leju agree that, upon the date of execution of this Termination Agreement, the Agreement shall terminate and be of no further force or effect. Certain provisions of the Original Agreement, specifically those pertaining to intellectual property rights, shall survive such termination indefinitely.
perturbation.explanation: This change introduces a contradiction. Section 1 initially states that no provisions of the Original Agreement survive the termination. The modified version states that specific clauses, those related to intellectual property, will remain in effect even after termination. This creates uncertainty about which aspects of the original contract are truly terminated.

perturbation.original_text: 2. This Termination Agreement represents the complete, integrated, and entire agreement between the parties, and may not be modified except in writing signed by the parties.
perturbation.changed_text: 2. This Termination Agreement represents the complete, integrated, and entire agreement between the parties. However, either party may unilaterally modify the terms of this Termination Agreement by providing written notice to the other party. Such modification shall take effect 30 days after the date of the notice.
perturbation.explanation: This perturbation directly contradicts the original intent that changes only be made in writing with mutual agreement. By enabling unilateral modification by either party, the initial clause loses its validity. This introduces uncertainty as it's now ambiguous whether mutual agreement is needed or unilateral modification is permissible.

perturbation.original_text: 5. This Termination Agreement shall be binding upon and inure to the benefit of the parties hereto and their respective successors and assigns.
perturbation.changed_text: 5. This Termination Agreement shall be binding upon and inure to the benefit of the parties hereto. However, this agreement may not be assigned or transferred to any third party without the express written consent of both parties, except that Beijing SINA may assign this agreement to any of its subsidiaries without such consent.
perturbation.explanation: This creates a contradiction by first stating the agreement is binding on successors and assigns, but then limiting assignment rights without consent, and then providing an exception to that limitation. It introduces confusion as to whether successors and assigns have the same rights originally agreed upon and makes enforcement unclear. The exception granted to Beijing SINA further complicates the matter.
